org.spongepowered.api.entity

Interface Entity

  • All Superinterfaces:
    CompositeValueStore<DataHolder,DataManipulator<?,?>>, DataHolder, DataSerializable, Identifiable, Locatable, PropertyHolder, Translatable, ValueContainer<DataHolder>
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    Aerial, Ageable, Agent, Ambient, Animal, Aquatic, AreaEffectCloud, ArmorStand, Arrow, Bat, Blaze, Boat, Boss, CaveSpider, ChestMinecart, Chicken, CommandBlockMinecart, ComplexLiving, ComplexLivingPart, ContainerMinecart<M>, Cow, Creature, Creeper, DamagingProjectile, Donkey, DragonFireball, Egg, EnderCrystal, EnderDragon, EnderDragonPart, Enderman, Endermite, EnderPearl, EntityTargetingProjectile, Evoker, ExperienceOrb, Explosive, EyeOfEnder, FallingBlock, Fireball, Firework, FishHook, FurnaceMinecart, FusedExplosive, Ghast, Giant, Golem, Guardian, Hanging, HopperMinecart, Horse, Hostile, Human, Humanoid, Husk, Illusioner, IronGolem, Item, ItemFrame, LargeFireball, LeashHitch, Lightning, Living, Llama, LlamaSpit, MagmaCube, Minecart, MobSpawnerMinecart, Monster, Mooshroom, Mule, Ocelot, Painting, Parrot, Pig, Player, PolarBear, PrimedTNT, Projectile, Rabbit, Ranger, RideableHorse, RideableMinecart, Sheep, Shulker, ShulkerBullet, Silverfish, Skeleton, SkeletonHorse, Slime, SmallFireball, Snowball, SnowGolem, SpectralArrow, Spider, Squid, Stray, ThrownExpBottle, ThrownPotion, TippedArrow, TNTMinecart, Vex, Villager, Vindicator, WeatherEffect, WhiteSkeleton, Witch, Wither, WitherSkeleton, WitherSkull, Wolf, Zombie, ZombieHorse, ZombiePigman, ZombieVillager

    public interface Entity
extends Identifiable, Locatable, DataHolder, Translatable
    An entity is a Minecraft entity.

    Examples of entities include:

    • Zombies
    • Sheep
    • Players
    • Dropped items
    • Dropped experience points
    • etc.

    Blocks and items (when they are in inventories) are not entities.

        Gets the Random Number Generator (RNG) for this entity.
        Returns:
        The RNG

      • setLocation

        boolean setLocation(Location<World> location)
        Sets the location of this entity. This is equivalent to a teleport, and also moves this entity's passengers.
        Parameters:
        location - The location to set
        Returns:
        True if location was set successfully, false if location couldn't be set due to MoveEntityEvent.Teleport being cancelled.

      • setLocationSafely

        default boolean setLocationSafely(Location<World> location)
        Sets the location of this entity using a safe one from TeleportHelper.getSafeLocation(Location). This is equivalent to a teleport and also moves this entity's passengers.
        Parameters:
        location - The location to set
        Returns:
        True if location was set successfully, false if location couldn't be set as no safe location was found or MoveEntityEvent.Teleport was cancelled.

      • getRotation

        com.flowpowered.math.vector.Vector3d getRotation()
        Gets the rotation.

        The format of the rotation is represented by:

        x -> pitch, y -> yaw, z -> roll

        Returns:
        The rotation

      • setRotation

        void setRotation(com.flowpowered.math.vector.Vector3d rotation)
        Sets the rotation of this entity.

        The format of the rotation is represented by:

        x -> pitch, y -> yaw, z -> roll

        Parameters:
        rotation - The rotation to set the entity to

      • setLocationAndRotation

        boolean setLocationAndRotation(Location<World> location,
                               com.flowpowered.math.vector.Vector3d rotation)
        Moves the entity to the specified location, and sets the rotation.

        The format of the rotation is represented by:

        x -> pitch, y -> yaw, z -> roll

        Parameters:
        location - The location to set
        rotation - The rotation to set
        Returns:
        True if location was set successfully, false if location couldn't be set due to MoveEntityEvent.Teleport being cancelled

      • setLocationAndRotation

        boolean setLocationAndRotation(Location<World> location,
                               com.flowpowered.math.vector.Vector3d rotation,
                               EnumSet<RelativePositions> relativePositions)
        Moves the entity to the specified location, and sets the rotation. RelativePositions listed inside the EnumSet are considered relative.

        The format of the rotation is represented by:

        x -> pitch, y -> yaw, z -> roll

        Parameters:
        location - The location to set
        rotation - The rotation to set
        relativePositions - The coordinates to set relatively
        Returns:
        True if location was set successfully, false if location couldn't be set due to MoveEntityEvent.Teleport being cancelled

      • setLocationAndRotationSafely

        default boolean setLocationAndRotationSafely(Location<World> location,
                                             com.flowpowered.math.vector.Vector3d rotation)
        Sets the location using a safe one from TeleportHelper.getSafeLocation(Location) and the rotation of this entity.

        The format of the rotation is represented by:

        x -> pitch, y -> yaw, z -> roll

        Parameters:
        location - The location to set
        rotation - The rotation to set
        Returns:
        True if location was set successfully, false if either location couldn't be set as no safe location was found or MoveEntityEvent.Teleport was cancelled

      • setLocationAndRotationSafely

        default boolean setLocationAndRotationSafely(Location<World> location,
                                             com.flowpowered.math.vector.Vector3d rotation,
                                             EnumSet<RelativePositions> relativePositions)
        Sets the location using a safe one from TeleportHelper.getSafeLocation(Location) and the rotation of this entity. RelativePositions listed inside the EnumSet are considered relative.

        The format of the rotation is represented by:

        x -> pitch, y -> yaw, z -> roll

        Parameters:
        location - The location to set
        rotation - The rotation to set
        relativePositions - The coordinates to set relatively
        Returns:
        True if location was set successfully, false if either location couldn't be set as no safe location was found or MoveEntityEvent.Teleport was cancelled

      • getScale

        com.flowpowered.math.vector.Vector3d getScale()
        Gets the entity scale. Not currently used. Returns Vector3d.ONE.
        Returns:
        The entity scale

      • setScale

        void setScale(com.flowpowered.math.vector.Vector3d scale)
        Sets the entity scale. Not currently used. Does nothing.
        Parameters:
        scale - The scale

      • getTransform

        Transform<World> getTransform()
        Returns the entity transform as a new copy. Combines the position, rotation and scale.
        Returns:
        The transform as a new copy

      • setTransform

        boolean setTransform(Transform<World> transform)
        Sets the entity transform. Sets the position, rotation and scale at once.
        Parameters:
        transform - The transform to set
        Returns:
        True if the transform was set successfully, false if the transform couldn't be set due to MoveEntityEvent.Teleport being cancelled.

      • setTransformSafely

        default boolean setTransformSafely(Transform<World> transform)
        Sets the transformation of this entity using a safe location from TeleportHelper.getSafeLocation(Location).
        Parameters:
        transform - The transform to set
        Returns:
        True if the transform was set successfully, or false if either the transform couldn't be set as no safe location was found or MoveEntityEvent.Teleport was cancelled

      • transferToWorld

        default boolean transferToWorld(World world)
        Sets the Location of this entity to the World's spawn point.

        This is equivalent to setting the location via TargetedLocationData.

        Parameters:
        world - The world to transfer to
        Returns:
        Whether the transfer was successful, returns false if the action is cancelled or not possible (eg. because the entity has been removed)

      • transferToWorld

        boolean transferToWorld(World world,
                        com.flowpowered.math.vector.Vector3d position)
        Sets the Location of this entity to a new position in a world.

        This is equivalent to setting the location via TargetedLocationData.

        Parameters:
        world - The world to transfer to
        position - The position in the target world
        Returns:
        Whether the transfer was successful, returns false if the action is cancelled or not possible (eg. because the entity has been removed)

      • transferToWorld

        default boolean transferToWorld(String worldName,
                                com.flowpowered.math.vector.Vector3d position)
        Sets the location of this entity to a new position in a world which does not have to be loaded (but must at least be enabled).

        If the target world is loaded then this is equivalent to setting the location via TargetedLocationData.

        If the target world is unloaded but is enabled according to its WorldArchetype.isEnabled() then this will first load the world before transferring the entity to that world.

        If the target world is unloaded and not enabled then the transfer will fail.

        Parameters:
        worldName - The name of the world to transfer to
        position - The position in the target world
        Returns:
        True if the teleport was successful

      • transferToWorld

        default boolean transferToWorld(UUID uuid,
                                com.flowpowered.math.vector.Vector3d position)
        Sets the location of this entity to a new position in a world which does not have to be loaded (but must at least be enabled).

        If the target world is loaded then this is equivalent to setting the location via TargetedLocationData.

        If the target world is unloaded but is enabled according to its WorldArchetype.isEnabled() then this will first load the world before transferring the entity to that world.

        If the target world is unloaded and not enabled then the transfer will fail.

        Parameters:
        uuid - The UUID of the target world to transfer to
        position - The position in the target world
        Returns:
        True if the teleport was successful

      • getBoundingBox

        Optional<AABB> getBoundingBox()
        Gets the entity's bounding box, usually for collisions and interaction. The box has an offset matching the entity's positions. That is to say, it is absolutely positioned and not relative to the entity.
        Returns:
        The axis aligned bounding box

      • setVehicle

        boolean setVehicle(@Nullable
                   Entity entity)
        Sets the vehicle entity (the entity that is ridden by this one).
        Parameters:
        entity - The entity vehicle, or null to dismount
        Returns:
        True if the set was successful

      • getBaseVehicle

        Entity getBaseVehicle()
        Gets the entity vehicle that is the base of what ever stack the current entity is a part of. This can be the current entity, if it is not riding any vehicle.

        The returned entity can never ride another entity, that would make the ridden entity the base of the stack.

        Returns:
        The vehicle entity, if available

      • getVelocity

        default com.flowpowered.math.vector.Vector3d getVelocity()
        Gets the Vector3d representation of this entity's current velocity.
        Returns:
        The current velocity

        Sets the velocity for this entity.
        Parameters:
        vector3d - The vector 3d velocity
        Returns:
        The resulting data transaction result

      • isOnGround

        Returns whether this entity is on the ground (not in the air) or not.
        Returns:
        Whether this entity is on the ground or not

      • isRemoved

        Returns whether this entity has been removed.
        Returns:

        Returns whether this entity is still loaded in a world/chunk.

        Parameters:

        Returns:

        Creates a new EntityArchetype for use with Schematics and placing the archetype in multiple locations.
